019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.Writer;
023import java.net.URI;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Arrays;
026import java.util.Collections;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Locale;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.stream.Collectors;
031import org.jdrupes.json.JsonArray;
032import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.Conlet.RenderMode;
033import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.RenderSupport;
034import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.AddPageResources.ScriptResource;
035
036/**
037 * Adds a web console component type with its global resources 
038 * (JavaScript and/or CSS) to the console page. Specifying global 
039 * resources result in the respective
040 * `<link .../>` or `<script ...></script>` nodes
041 * being added to the page's `<head>` node.
042 * 
043 * This in turn causes the browser to issue `GET` requests that
044 * (usually) refer to the web console component's resources. These requests are
045 * converted to {@link ConletResourceRequest}s by the web console and
046 * sent to the web console components, which must respond to the requests.
047 * 
048 * The sequence of events is shown in the diagram.
049 * 
050 * ![WebConsole Ready Event Sequence](AddConletTypeSeq.svg)
051 * 
052 * See {@link ResourceRequest} for details about the processing
053 * of the {@link ConletResourceRequest}.
054 * 
055 * A conlet's JavaScript may (and probably must) make use of
056 * the functions provided by the web console page. See the 
057 * <a href="../jsdoc/classes/console.html">JavaScript
058 * documentation of these functions</a> for details.
059 * 
060 * @startuml AddConletTypeSeq.svg
061 * hide footbox
062 * 
063 * activate Browser
064 * Browser -> WebConsole: "consoleReady"
065 * deactivate Browser
066 * activate WebConsole
067 * WebConsole -> ConletX: ConsoleReady 
068 * deactivate WebConsole
069 * activate ConletX
070 * ConletX -> WebConsole: AddConletType 
071 * deactivate ConletX
072 * activate WebConsole
073 * WebConsole -> Browser: "addConletType"
074 * activate Browser
075 * deactivate WebConsole
076 * Browser -> WebConsole: "GET <conlet resource URI>"
077 * activate WebConsole
078 * WebConsole -> ConletX: ConletResourceRequest
079 * deactivate Browser
080 * activate ConletX
081 * deactivate ConletX
082 * 
083 * @enduml
084 */
085public class AddConletType extends ConsoleCommand {
086
087    private final String conletType;
088    private Map<Locale, String> displayNames = Collections.emptyMap();
089    private final List<URI> cssUris = new ArrayList<>();
090    private final List<ScriptResource> scriptResources = new ArrayList<>();
091    private List<RenderMode> renderModes;
092
093    /**
094     * Create a new event for the given web console component type.
095     * 
096     * @param conletType a unique id for the web console component type 
097     * (usually the class name)
098     */
099    public AddConletType(String conletType) {
100        this.conletType = conletType;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Return the web console component type.
105     * 
106     * @return the web console component type
107     */
108    public String conletType() {
109        return conletType;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Sets the display names.
114     * 
115     * @param displayNames the display names
116     * @return the event for easy chaining
117     */
118    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
119    public AddConletType setDisplayNames(Map<Locale, String> displayNames) {
120        this.displayNames = displayNames;
121        return this;
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Return the display names.
126     * 
127     * @return the displayNames
128     */
129    public Map<Locale, String> displayNames() {
130        return displayNames;
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Add a render mode to be offered to the user. Several modes may
135     * be added. The modes {@link RenderMode#Preview} and 
136     * {@link RenderMode#View} usually cause the conlet type to be added 
137     * to a menu. If a conlet type's only mode is
138     * {@link RenderMode#Component}, it shouldn't be offered to the user
139     * at all.  
140     *
141     * @param mode the mode
142     * @return the event for easy chaining
143     */
144    public AddConletType addRenderMode(RenderMode mode) {
145        if (renderModes == null) {
146            renderModes = new ArrayList<>();
147        }
148        renderModes.add(mode);
149        return this;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Return the render modes.
154     * 
155     * @return the result
156     */
157    public List<RenderMode> renderModes() {
158        if (renderModes == null) {
159            return Collections.emptyList();
160        }
161        return renderModes;
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Add a script resource to be requested by the browser.
166     * 
167     * @param scriptResource the script resource
168     * @return the event for easy chaining
169     */
170    public AddConletType addScript(ScriptResource scriptResource) {
171        scriptResources.add(scriptResource);
172        return this;
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Add the URI of a CSS resource that is to be added to the
177     * header section of the web console page.
178     *
179     * @param renderSupport the render support for mapping the `uri`
180     * @param uri the URI
181     * @return the event for easy chaining
182     */
183    public AddConletType addCss(RenderSupport renderSupport, URI uri) {
184        cssUris.add(renderSupport.conletResource(conletType(), uri));
185        return this;
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Return all script resources.
190     * 
191     * @return the result
192     */
193    public ScriptResource[] scriptResources() {
194        return scriptResources.toArray(new ScriptResource[0]);
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Return all CSS URIs.
199     * 
200     * @return the result
201     */
202    public URI[] cssUris() {
203        return cssUris.toArray(new URI[0]);
204    }
205
206    @Override
207    public void toJson(Writer writer) throws IOException {
208        JsonArray strArray = JsonArray.create();
209        for (ScriptResource scriptResource : scriptResources()) {
210            strArray.append(scriptResource.toJsonValue());
211        }
212        toJson(writer, "addConletType", conletType(),
213            displayNames().entrySet().stream()
214                .collect(Collectors.toMap(e -> e.getKey().toLanguageTag(),
215                    e -> e.getValue())),
216            Arrays.stream(cssUris()).map(
217                uri -> uri.toString()).toArray(String[]::new),
218            strArray, renderModes().stream().map(RenderMode::name)
219                .toArray(size -> new String[size]));
220    }
221}
